alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 4:25AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jefferson, southeastern Morris, Shawnee, northwestern Douglas, southeastern Wabaunsee, northwestern Osage, southeastern Jackson and Lyon Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 425 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Effingham to near Strong City. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Emporia, Osage City, Carbondale, Valley Falls, Oskaloosa, Eskridge, Tecumseh, Richland, Dover, Silver Lake, Auburn, Burlingame, Perry, Americus, Meriden, Scranton, Hoyt, Ozawkie and Nortonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 128 and 140. Interstate 70 between mile markers 344 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 126 and 192. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
